title: I'll be disappointed in Riot if
body:
Zyra doesn't get bonus effects from jungle plants.

Exploding plant - Knocks units back 1 unit more 
Healing plant - Heals 1 more health and mana
Vision plant - Vision is granted for .1 secs more.

Rito come on, let the Plant Queen do her thing.

replies.body: We've talked about whether we should do a few champion, mastery or item effects that interact with plants. Conclusion was that that was something that could be pretty cool, but that we should wait until the system's demonstrated that it does what we were hoping and that we've been able to balance it appropriately.
I think the OP is talking about cheese extra stats, like people with sunglasses taking 1 reduced damage from Leona passive.
Even at that level I think we're better off putting the time somewhere else until we're confident plants are a good addition to the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2016-10-14T06:12:25.608+0000)
>
> Even at that level I think we're better off putting the time somewhere else until we're confident plants are a good addition to the game.

Can you comment on whether sunglasses affect Leona's damage in ranked? I think it's a very slippery slope and a horrible mistake if such things have impact beyond look and feel.
Were there any types of plants which didn't make the cut?

> [{quoted}](name=TheSlogs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-10-14T02:44:41.130+0000)
>
> I think the OP is talking about cheese extra stats, like people with sunglasses taking 1 reduced damage from Leona passive.

Is that still in there? I am completely against something like this regardless of how minor it is.
I heard it's disabled for official competitions, but I think it's still active in Ranked.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-14T13:57:52.454+0000)
>
> I heard it's disabled for official competitions, but I think it's still active in Ranked.

And here I thought skins were purely cosmetic...

Oh, don't whine... You've most probably never lost a match over the 1 damage or 1 gold that this kind of buffs provide. You can be against it in principles, but if it has no practical consequences, you have no reason to refuse the flavor and the fun it provides.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-15T18:14:05.714+0000)
>
> Oh, don't whine... You've most probably never lost a match over the 1 damage or 1 gold that this kind of buffs provide. You can be against it in principles, but if it has no practical consequences, you have no reason to refuse the flavor and the fun it provides.

It doesn't matter. This game isn't pay to win just because a skin affects damage but it's completely misguided to ever have cosmetic things you buy change the effectiveness of a champion to ANY degree for a ranked mode. Philosophically, I am appalled that this was ever implemented for a ranked mode.

It wasn't "implemented for a Ranked mode"... <_<  It was just implemented for the normal game, and they didn't bother to remove it for Ranked, because it has no actual impact.

Each modification to the game is a risk of introducing bugs, and maintaining 2 versions in parallel is costly. Given Riot history with spaghetti code, I'm much more in favor of cosmetic "buffs" with realistically no impact than with the alternative...

Professional competitions are another story, you don't need to upgrade them patch-to-patch, so it's much easier. Plus, to be honest, I'm not 100% sure it's actually disabled for pros, it's just something I heard second-hand.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-16T20:14:32.111+0000)
>
> It wasn't "implemented for a Ranked mode"... <_<  It was just implemented for the normal game, and they didn't bother to remove it for Ranked, because it has no actual impact.
> 
> Each modification to the game is a risk of introducing bugs, and maintaining 2 versions in parallel is costly. Given Riot history with spaghetti code, I'm much more in favor of cosmetic "buffs" with realistically no impact than with the alternative...
> 
> Professional competitions are another story, you don't need to upgrade them patch-to-patch, so it's much easier. Plus, to be honest, I'm not 100% sure it's actually disabled for pros, it's just something I heard second-hand.

It DOES have an impact, regardless of how small. You could make the same argument about some runes or masteries - small things add up. 

If you believe it has no impact and no one would notice either way, why have it in there to begin with? It serves no positive role and negatively affects the integrity of the game. While I think it's inexcusable for this to apply in ranked, I don't think it's fair in ANY mode. It is an advantage based on cosmetic factors and should never exist just on principle.

Have you ever been killed by a Trundle's Pillar? Not BECAUSE of it or it's slow. BY it. By the 1 true damage it causes. My bet will be no. Hell, I doubt anyone in the history of League has survived with 1 hp and got killed by a 1 true dmg ability like Trundle's Pillar or Fizz's Ult (before the damage, it applies 6 true damage over it's duration).

It is an "advantage". Yeah. You could, technically, survive with 1 hp when being hit by a Leona and get away. You will just never end up in such a situation. In a game where ADCs will be hitting you for 500 damage every half a sec, mages will be doing 2k damage in one rotation and assassins will be hitting 2-3k damage in 1 second, 1 damage is not going to change anything.

> [{quoted}](name=TequilaZombie,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-16T21:36:13.503+0000)
>
> Have you ever been killed by a Trundle's Pillar? Not BECAUSE of it or it's slow. BY it. By the 1 true damage it causes. My bet will be no. Hell, I doubt anyone in the history of League has survived with 1 hp and got killed by a 1 true dmg ability like Trundle's Pillar or Fizz's Ult (before the damage, it applies 6 true damage over it's duration).
> 
> It is an "advantage". Yeah. You could, technically, survive with 1 hp when being hit by a Leona and get away. You will just never end up in such a situation. In a game where ADCs will be hitting you for 500 damage every half a sec, mages will be doing 2k damage in one rotation and assassins will be hitting 2-3k damage in 1 second, 1 damage is not going to change anything.

That's a terrible argument and like I mentioned, can apply to runes, masteries and a bunch of other things. They do add up and sometimes your team as a whole can get something they shouldn't even if that individual didn't. I've certainly seen people survive on 5 hp before. And again, if your argument is that it makes no difference, then it SHOULD NOT EXIST by virtue of that same logic. It's merely another source of potential controversy regarding ranked integrity. 

Why open that can of worms for something which "doesn't matter"? If that's true, why would the person with the skin have any qualms about removing this? There is no world where someone can come up with a good justification for paid "cosmetic" addons to affect performance in any objective way while claiming that competitive integrity matters. It violates every principle of a fair game just by virtue of existing to ANY degree. It's much more of a philosophical issue than it is a practical one. If you think it's ok to reduce damage from Leona by wearing sunglasses, maybe we can make Zac's pool party skin reduce damage from Brand by 2 and why stop there?

Masteries, runes and such add MUCH bigger bonuses than 1 true damage mitigation from a specific supports ult. At tier 1 you already have 2% extra spell damage. Hell, if you put it all together, you gain something close to 12% extra damage with masteries. Not counting penetrations, mobility, tankiness or shit loads of dmg with the keystones.

Runes can easily add 15 AD on their own. And they are considered to be almost worthless right now.

1 true damage blocked on Leona's ult is so goddamn neglectable that makes absolutely zero difference being there, balance and rank integrity wise.

Why is it there, then? For fun. League of Legends is a game. A game's purpose is to allow the players to have fun. It's a fun little thing that doesn't make any difference in game play, but acts as an easter egg. Kinda like Ninjas (Kennen, Zed, Akali, Shen...) lose 1 max health when other ninjas are in the same team because ninjas work alone.

Yes. If we're going by the straight up "this is a competition and shouldn't have any sort of deviations" mentality, having it is wrong by the principle of it. However it is a 100% harmless gimmick from the game and has no reason to be removed.

> [{quoted}](name=TequilaZombie,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=000200000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-17T01:04:57.900+0000)
>
> Masteries, runes and such add MUCH bigger bonuses than 1 true damage mitigation from a specific supports ult. At tier 1 you already have 2% extra spell damage. Kinda like Ninjas (Kennen, Zed, Akali, Shen...) lose 1 max health when other ninjas are in the same team because ninjas work alone.
> 
> Yes. If we're going by the straight up "this is a competition and shouldn't have any sort of deviations" mentality, having it is wrong by the principle of it. However it is a 100% harmless gimmick from the game and has no reason to be removed.

1 point in a mastery doesn't give you those numbers. For example, 1 point in Unyielding is 1% BONUS MR and Armor which for the first 10-15 minutes is usually not even a full Armor or MR point. Vampirism gives 0.4% Spellvamp and Lifesteal. Recovery gives 0.4 Hp per 5. Even this sunglass bonus will be worth more than one point in recovery over a typical fight duration. These masteries aren't even considered  weak. League is a game of small advantages. You could use the same logic about how missing 1 cs doesn't matter and so on but it all adds up, especially in the context of 5 people and if even one game out of a million is affected by such nonsense, it's already one too many.

 If it's "for fun" and yet "isn't noticeable and doesn't matter at all," I don't see how it is any more interesting for those with the skin. It's certainly not more fun for Leona knowing her kit does a tiny bit less damage due to someone purchasing a skin. I think those other "easter eggs" are equally stupid if they exist in ranked and I'm extremely disappointed Riot even considered this, let alone implemented it. The fun part of cosmetic addons shouldn't be based on numbers in ANY way. They  can add some voiceover like "Good thing I've got these shades." (hopefully something better than that) but touching the numbers is a fundamental and unjustifiable mistake for a competitive game. I will never agree about this and there is no valid defense for it. It is not harmless and is in fact a very worrying and dangerous addition, not only for its own sake due to the mindset which was necessary to consider this OK.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-17T10:33:26.377+0000)
>
> Don't try to argue, there is no discussion possible about the scale of the effect. The cosmetic buffs from skins are an order of magnitude below the effects of the Masteries or Runes systems. Last time I checked, you have 10 different Masteries, and you counted 1/5th of one of these 10 over the duration of a typical fight versus something that happens at most once every few minutes. Except that guess what, Recovery isn't supposed to be an in-combat Mastery; on the other hand, even a single point of Vampirism is more than 1 HP "over the duration of a typical fight", and you "typically" have 5 of those points. There is no common measure, the cosmetic buffs ARE indeed negligible.
> 
> And for fuck's sake, it's a JOKE. It's funny when you learn about it, it's a bit of trivia you can chat about with other players, you can make memes and banter about it with your opponents. It makes the bloody GAME more enjoyable, without affecting the game play. For all I know, maybe Riot has been trolling us all for years and there is just some text in the loading screen and the actual in-game effect was never actually implemented. I never checked. Did you?
> 
> (P.S.: and you seem to think they added that for *Skins*, as in, "the stuff you pay for with real money", but most of the cosmetic buffs apply to champions (Ninjas work alone, The Piltover Trio, Ninjas vs Pirates, Volibear vs Zilean, etc.). Only the Sunglasses stuff applies **also** to Skins, but champs with sunglasses on their base skin are affected too. You can't even say that Riot did that to promote the use of Skins, because it's obviously not the case, or all the Pirate and Bilgewater skins would trigger the Ninjas vs Pirates buff.)

Yes, I counted 1/5 of one because that's the unit assigned. You get one point per level. This skin buff has a chance to be more impactful than one level's worth of masteries. Are you willing to play every game with only 29 points in masteries? 

Don't worry, I disagree with most of the similar instances too. I value competitive integrity above gimmicks and ANY unfairness introduced by them is philosophically repulsive to me. Imagine if they did shit like this in sports tournaments. Instead of flipping a coin for who serves in tennis, they decide it based on whether you have a jersey they're selling. Does it change the outcome of the match? Unlikely, but does that make it fair and acceptable? It certainly doesn't to me.

> [{quoted}](name=TequilaZombie,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9fFWtNhb,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-10-17T10:40:35.967+0000)

>

>

>

> 
> Hell, I'm more worried about the fact that when Chum the Waters is the killing blow on a Yordle (who's not Rumble), he eats the body, which disapears from the map. That's hiding information just because a character happens to have a certain lore. Yet, it doesn't cause any problems.
> 
> League is a game. You may not find it fun, but I assure you that many people find ninjas being stronger alone, taking less dmg because of sunglasses, and having a shark eat yordles a amusing addition to the game.

It's not funny at all and is in fact absolutely awful design to ANY degree if it impacts a ranked mode. It terrifies me that this was even considered let alone implemented. Where do you draw the line anyway? 1 damage reduction is OK if you pay for a skin but 2 is not? Is that really such a bigger difference? No? Why not 3? 

It should NEVER affect numbers and again, the argument that "it doesn't matter," goes both ways. If it's true, why affect game integrity with gimmicks? There are a million ways to make the game more fun or a cosmetic addition more interesting. Touching numbers is the one thing you don't do. 

Just because League is a game meant for fun doesn't mean design and balance principles go out the window. The most fun thing about the game for me is the competitive element and that depends on being able to trust the company to do what is fair for everyone at all times. I think anyone who disagrees with this really doesn't care about this game's future or the competitive element very much (and yes, it's possible not to care despite being ranked highly). You can have all your imbalanced fun silliness, but just not in ranked.

BTW: By add up, I mean that if this effect is run hundreds of thousands of times, it can sometimes lead to a person surviving when they otherwise wouldn't (especially in the context of a hectic teamfight where people at high levels push every drop of life they have left).

Leona's entire kit will do 741 damage to her target at level 6. If by any chance she's unloading her combo on someone with a commando skin, she will do 740.

For all pratical means, there is no difference. It is not going to "add up" because it's only for her ult, which has a 90/75/60 seconds CD. 

If you wanna worry about something regarding skins, worry about how Masked Shaco change his smoke color, making it harder to see. Or how some skins makes projectiles look smaller than their actual hit box.

While I agree that the mindset is not the very best in a 100% competitive environment, the actual change is harmless.

Hell, I'm more worried about the fact that when Chum the Waters is the killing blow on a Yordle (who's not Rumble), he eats the body, which disapears from the map. That's hiding information just because a character happens to have a certain lore. Yet, it doesn't cause any problems.

League is a game. You may not find it fun, but I assure you that many people find ninjas being stronger alone, taking less dmg because of sunglasses, and having a shark eat yordles a amusing addition to the game.

Don't try to argue, there is no discussion possible about the scale of the effect. The cosmetic buffs from skins are an order of magnitude below the effects of the Masteries or Runes systems. Last time I checked, you have 10 different Masteries, and you counted 1/5th of one of these 10 over the duration of a typical fight versus something that happens at most once every few minutes. Except that guess what, Recovery isn't supposed to be an in-combat Mastery; on the other hand, even a single point of Vampirism is more than 1 HP "over the duration of a typical fight", and you "typically" have 5 of those points. There is no common measure, the cosmetic buffs ARE indeed negligible.

And for fuck's sake, it's a JOKE. It's funny when you learn about it, it's a bit of trivia you can chat about with other players, you can make memes and banter about it with your opponents. It makes the bloody GAME more enjoyable, without affecting the game play. For all I know, maybe Riot has been trolling us all for years and there is just some text in the loading screen and the actual in-game effect was never actually implemented. I never checked. Did you?

(P.S.: and you seem to think they added that for *Skins*, as in, "the stuff you pay for with real money", but most of the cosmetic buffs apply to champions (Ninjas work alone, The Piltover Trio, Ninjas vs Pirates, Volibear vs Zilean, etc.). Only the Sunglasses stuff applies **also** to Skins, but champs with sunglasses on their base skin are affected too. You can't even say that Riot did that to promote the use of Skins, because it's obviously not the case, or all the Pirate and Bilgewater skins would trigger the Ninjas vs Pirates buff.)
